member.name: T:Xunit.SkippableFactAttribute
member.summary: Attribute that is applied to a method to indicate that it is a fact that should be run by the test runner. The test may produce a "skipped test" result by calling or otherwise throwing a .

member.name: M:Xunit.SkippableFactAttribute.#ctor(System.Type[])
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.param: Exception types that, if thrown, should cause the test to register as skipped.

member.name: T:Xunit.SkippableTheoryAttribute
member.summary: Marks a test method as being a data theory. Data theories are tests which are fed various bits of data from a data source, mapping to parameters on the test method. If the data source contains multiple rows, then the test method is executed multiple times (once with each data row). Data is provided by attributes which derive from Xunit.Sdk.DataAttribute (notably, Xunit.InlineDataAttribute and Xunit.MemberDataAttribute). The test may produce a "skipped test" result by calling or otherwise throwing a .

member.name: M:Xunit.SkippableTheoryAttribute.#ctor(System.Type[])
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.param: Exception types that, if thrown, should cause the test to register as skipped.
